function.name: gtk_box_pack_start
function.description:
Left side insert a widget to a box. The expand argument to pack_start() or pack_end() controls whether the widgets are laid out in the box to fill in all the extra space in the box so the box is expanded to fill the area allocated to it (%TRUE). Or the box is shrunk to just fit the widgets (%FALSE). Setting @expand to %FALSE will allow you to do right and left justifying of your widgets. Otherwise, they will all expand to fit in the box, and the same effect could be achieved by using only one of pack_start() or pack_end() functions.
The @fill argument to the pack_start()/pack_end() functions control whether the extra space is allocated to the objects themselves (%TRUE), or as extra padding in the box around these objects (%FALSE). It only has an effect if the @expand argument is also %TRUE.
The difference between spacing (set when the box is created) and padding (set when elements are packed) is, that spacing is added between objects, and padding is added on either side of an object.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_default_attributes
function.description: Obtains a copy of the default text attributes. These are the attributes used for text unless a tag overrides them. You'd typically pass the default attributes in to Gtk::TextIter::get_attributes() in order to get the attributes in effect at a given text position.

function.name: gtk_label_get_label
function.return: the text of the label widget.

function.name: gtk_label_get_text
function.return: the text in the label widget.

function.name: gtk_label_get_layout
function.description: Gets the #PangoLayout used to display the label. The layout is useful to e.g. convert text positions to pixel positions, in combination with gtk_label_get_layout_offsets().

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_tab_label_text
function.return: the text of the tab label.

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_menu_label_text
function.return: the text of the tab label.

function.name: gtk_text_buffer_create_mark
function.description:
Creates a mark at position @where. The mark can be retrieved by name using gtk_text_buffer_get_mark (). If a mark has left gravity, and text is inserted at the mark's current location, the mark will be moved to the left of the newly-inserted text. If the mark has right gravity (@left_gravity = %FALSE), the mark will end up on the right of newly-inserted text. The standard left-to-right cursor is a mark with right gravity (when you type, the cursor stays on the right side of the text you're typing).
Emits the "mark_set" signal as notification of the mark's initial placement.

function.name: gtk_text_buffer_delete_mark
function.description: Deletes @mark, so that it's no longer located anywhere in the buffer. Removes the reference the buffer holds to the mark, so if you don't keep a Glib::RefPtr to the mark, it will be freed. Even if the mark isn't freed, most operations on @mark become invalid. There is no way to undelete a mark. gtk_text_mark_get_deleted () will return TRUE after this function has been called on a mark; gtk_text_mark_get_deleted () indicates that a mark no longer belongs to a buffer. The "mark_deleted" signal will be emitted as notification after the mark is deleted.

function.name: gtk_text_iter_get_tags
function.description: Returns a list of tags that apply to @iter, in ascending order of priority (highest-priority tags are last).

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_tabs
function.description: Gets the default tabs for @text_view. Tags in the buffer may override the defaults. The returned array will be empty if "standard" (8-space) tabs are used.
function.return: copy of default tab array, or an empty array if "standard" tabs are used.

function.name: gtk_dialog_run
gtk_accel_label_get_accel_width
function.description: Gets the width needed to display this accelerator label. This is used by menus to align all of the Gtk::MenuItem widgets, and shouldn't be needed by applications.
function.return: width of this accelerator label.

function.name: gtk_accel_label_refetch
function.description: Recreates the string representing the accelerator keys.
function.return: always returns %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_changed
function.description: Emits a "changed" signal from the Adjustment. This is typically called by the owner of the Adjustment after it has changed any of the Adjustment fields other than the value.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_value_changed
function.description: Emits a "value_changed" signal from the Adjustment. This is typically called by the owner of the Adjustment after it has changed the Adjustment value field.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_clamp_page
function.description: Updates the Adjustment value to ensure that the range between the parameters @lower and @upper is in the current page (i.e. between @value and @value + @page_size). If this range is larger than the page size, then only the start of it will be in the current page. A "changed" signal will be emitted if the value is changed.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_value
function.description: Sets the current value of the Adjustment

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: Ignored :)

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: The new value of the Adjustment

function.name: gtk_alignment_set
function.description: Sets the Alignment values.

parameter.name: alignment
parameter.parameter_description: Ignored :)

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: The horizontal alignment of the child of this Alignment, from 0 (left) to 1 (right).

parameter.name: yalign
parameter.parameter_description: The vertical alignment of the child of this Alignment, from 0 (top) to 1 (bottom).

parameter.name: xscale
parameter.parameter_description: The amount that the child expands horizontally to fill up unused space, from 0 to 1. A value of 0 indicates that the child widget should never expand. A value of 1 indicates that the child widget will expand to fill all the space allocated for the Alignment.

parameter.name: yscale
parameter.parameter_description: The amount that the child widget expands vertically to fill up unused space from 0 to 1. The values are similar to @xscale.

function.name: gtk_arrow_set
function.description: Sets the direction and shadow of this Arrow.

parameter.name: arrow
parameter.parameter_description: Ignored :)

parameter.name: arrow_type
parameter.parameter_description: A Gtk::ArrowType enum describing what arrow type to set this Arrow to.

parameter.name: shadow_type
parameter.parameter_description: A Gtk::ShadowType enum describing what shadow type to set this Arrow to.

function.name: gtk_text_child_anchor_get_widgets
function.description: Gets a list of all widgets anchored at this child anchor.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_path
function.description: Returns a #GtkTreePath referenced by @iter.

parameter.name: tree_model
parameter.parameter_description: A #GtkTreeModel.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkTreeIter.

function.return: a #GtkTreePath.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_rows_reordered
function.description:
Emits the #GtkTreeModel::rows-reordered signal on @tree_model.
This should be called by models when their rows have been reordered.

parameter.name: tree_model
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreeModel

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath pointing to the tree node whose children have been reordered

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid #GtkTreeIter pointing to the node whose children have been reordered, or %NULL if the depth of @path is 0

parameter.name: new_order
parameter.parameter_description: an array of integers mapping the current position of each child to its old position before the re-ordering, i.e. new_order<literal>[newpos] = oldpos</literal>

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_columns
function.description: Returns a list of all the #GtkTreeViewColumn s currently in @tree_view.

function.name: gtk_window_get_default_icon_list
function.description: Gets the value set by Gtk::Window::set_default_icon_list().

function.name: gtk_window_set_default
function.description: The default widget is the widget that's activated when the user presses Enter in a dialog (for example). This function sets or unsets the default widget for a #GtkWindow. When setting (rather than unsetting) the default widget it's generally easier to call gtk_widget_grab_focus() on the widget. Before making a widget the default widget, you must set the #GTK_CAN_DEFAULT flag on the widget you'd like to make the default using Gtk::Widget::set_flags().

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkWindow

parameter.name: default_widget
parameter.parameter_description: widget to be the default.

function.name: gtk_menu_item_set_accel_path
function.description:
Set the accelerator path on @menu_item, through which runtime changes of the menu item's accelerator caused by the user can be identified and saved to persistant storage (see gtk_accel_map_save() on this). To setup a default accelerator for this menu item, call gtk_accel_map_add_entry() with the same @accel_path. See also gtk_accel_map_add_entry() on the specifics of accelerator paths, and gtk_menu_set_accel_path() for a more convenient variant of this function.
This function is basically a convenience wrapper that handles calling gtk_widget_set_accel_path() with the appropriate accelerator group for the menu item.
Note that you do need to set an accelerator on the parent menu with gtk_menu_set_accel_group() for this to work.

parameter.name: menu_item
parameter.parameter_description: a valid #GtkMenuItem

parameter.name: accel_path
parameter.parameter_description: accelerator path, corresponding to this menu item's functionality.

parameter.name: notebook
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkNotebook

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to use as the contents of the page.

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to be used as the label for the page.

parameter.name: notebook
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkNotebook

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to use as the contents of the page.

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to be used as the label for the page.

parameter.name: menu_label
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to use as a label for the page-switch menu.

parameter.name: notebook
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkNotebook

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to use as the contents of the page.

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to be used as the label for the page.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the index (starting at 0) at which to insert the page, or -1 to append the page after all other pages.

parameter.name: notebook
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkNotebook

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to use as the contents of the page.

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to be used as the label for the page..

parameter.name: menu_label
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to use as a label for the page-switch menu.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the index (starting at 0) at which to insert the page, or -1 to append the page after all other pages.

parameter.name: notebook
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkNotebook

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to use as the contents of the page.

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to be used as the label for the page.

parameter.name: notebook
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkNotebook

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to use as the contents of the page.

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to be used as the label for the page.

parameter.name: menu_label
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to use as a label for the page-switch menu.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_background_area
function.description: Fills the bounding rectangle in tree window coordinates for the cell at the row specified by @path and the column specified by @column. The returned rectangle is equivalent to the @background_area passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render(). These background areas tile to cover the entire tree window (except for the area used for header buttons). Contrast with the @cell_area, returned by gtk_tree_view_get_cell_area(), which returns only the cell itself, excluding surrounding borders and the tree expander area.

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreeView

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath for the row.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreeViewColumn for the column.

parameter.name: rect
parameter.parameter_description: rectangle to fill with cell background rect

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_cell_area
function.description: Fills the bounding rectangle in tree window coordinates for the cell at the row specified by @path and the column specified by @column. If @path points to a path not currently displayed, the @y and @height fields of the rectangle will be filled with 0. The sum of all cell rects does not cover the entire tree; there are extra pixels in between rows, for example. The returned rectangle is equivalent to the @cell_area passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render(). This function is only valid if #tree_view is realized.

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreeView

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath for the row.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreeViewColumn for the column.

parameter.name: rect
parameter.parameter_description: rectangle to fill with cell rect

function.name: gtk_widget_set_tooltip_markup
function.description:
Sets @markup as the contents of the tooltip, which is marked up with the <link linkend="PangoMarkupFormat">Pango text markup language</link>.
This function will take care of setting GtkWidget:has-tooltip to %TRUE and of the default handler for the GtkWidget::query-tooltip signal.
See also the GtkWidget:tooltip-markup property and gtk_tooltip_set_markup().
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkWidget

parameter.name: markup
parameter.parameter_description: the contents of the tooltip for @widget.

function.name: gtk_widget_get_composite_name
function.return: the composite name of @widget, or an empty string if @widget is not a composite child.

function.name: gtk_window_set_default
function.description: The default widget is the widget that's activated when the user presses Enter in a dialog (for example). This function sets the default widget for a #GtkWindow. When setting (rather than unsetting) the default widget it's generally easier to call gtk_widget_grab_focus() on the widget. Before making a widget the default widget, you must set the #GTK_CAN_DEFAULT flag on the widget you'd like to make the default using GTK_WIDGET_SET_FLAGS().

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkWindow

parameter.name: default_widget
parameter.parameter_description: widget to be the default.

function.name: gtk_window_set_focus
function.description: If @focus is not the current focus widget, and is focusable, sets it as the focus widget for the window. To set the focus to a particular widget in the toplevel, it is usually more convenient to use gtk_widget_grab_focus() instead of this function.

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkWindow

parameter.name: focus
parameter.parameter_description: widget to be the new focus widget.

function.name: gtk_drag_dest_find_target
function.description: Looks for a match between @context->targets and the @dest_target_list, returning the first matching target, otherwise returning %GDK_NONE. @dest_target_list should usually be the return value from gtk_drag_dest_get_target_list(), but some widgets may have different valid targets for different parts of the widget; in that case, they will have to implement a drag_motion handler that passes the correct target list to this function.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: drag destination widget

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: drag context

parameter.name: target_list
parameter.parameter_description: list of droppable targets.

function.return: first target that the source offers and the dest can accept, or %GDK_NONE

function.name: gtk_clipboard_wait_for_text
function.return: A UTF-8 string, which is empty if retrieving the selection data failed. (This could happen for various reasons, in particular if the clipboard was empty or if the contents of the clipboard could not be converted into text form.)

function.name: gtk_tree_path_to_string

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: A #GtkTreePath

function.return: The string.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_string_from_iter

parameter.name: tree_model
parameter.parameter_description: A #GtkTreeModel.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An #GtkTreeIter.

function.return: The string.

function.name: gtk_window_set_icon_from_file
function.description:
Sets the icon for the window.
This function is equivalent to calling gtk_window_set_icon() with a pixbuf created by loading the image from @filename.

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkWindow

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: location of icon file

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkWindow

parameter.name: root_x
parameter.parameter_description: return location for X coordinate of gravity-determined reference point

parameter.name: root_y
parameter.parameter_description: return location for Y coordinate of gravity-determined reference point

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: location of icon file

function.name: gtk_tree_view_move_column_after
function.description: Moves @column to be after to @base_column. See also move_column_to_start().

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: A #GtkTreeView

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkTreeViewColumn to be moved.

parameter.name: base_column
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkTreeViewColumn to be moved relative to.

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_size
function.description: Obtains the width and height needed to render the cell. Used by view widgets to determine the appropriate size for the cell_area passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render(). Fills in the x and y offsets of the cell relative to this location. Please note that the values set in @width and @height, as well as those in @x_offset and @y_offset are inclusive of the xpad and ypad properties.

parameter.name: cell
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkCellRenderer

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget the renderer is rendering to

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: The area a cell will be allocated.

parameter.name: x_offset
parameter.parameter_description: location to return x offset of cell relative to @cell_area.

parameter.name: y_offset
parameter.parameter_description: location to return y offset of cell relative to @cell_area.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: location to return width needed to render a cell.

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: location to return height needed to render a cell.

function.name: gtk_menu_popup
function.description:
Displays a menu and makes it available for selection. Applications can use this function to display context-sensitive menus. The default menu positioning function will position the menu at the current mouse cursor position.
The @button parameter should be the mouse button pressed to initiate the menu popup. If the menu popup was initiated by something other than a mouse button press, such as a mouse button release or a keypress, @button should be 0.
The @activate_time parameter should be the time stamp of the event that initiated the popup. If such an event is not available, use gtk_get_current_event_time() instead.

parameter.name: menu
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkMenu.

parameter.name: parent_menu_shell
parameter.parameter_description: the menu shell containing the triggering menu item.

parameter.name: parent_menu_item
parameter.parameter_description: the menu item whose activation triggered the popup.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a user supplied function used to position the menu, or %NULL

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: user supplied data to be passed to @func.

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: the mouse button which was pressed to initiate the event.

parameter.name: activate_time
parameter.parameter_description: the time at which the activation event occurred.

parameter.name: tree_column
parameter.parameter_description: A #GtkTreeViewColumn.

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: The area a cell in the column will be allocated.

parameter.name: x_offset
parameter.parameter_description: location to return x offset of a cell relative to @cell_area.

parameter.name: y_offset
parameter.parameter_description: location to return y offset of a cell relative to @cell_area.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: location to return width needed to render a cell.

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: location to return height needed to render a cell.

parameter.name: tree_column
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreeViewColumn

parameter.name: cell_renderer
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkCellRenderer

parameter.name: start_pos
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the horizontal position of @cell within @tree_column.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the width of @cell.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_vadjustment
function.description: Sets the #GtkAdjustment for the current vertical aspect. See also unset_vadjustment().

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: A #GtkTreeView

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkAdjustment to set.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_hadjustment
function.description: Sets the #GtkAdjustment for the current horizontal aspect. See also unset_hadjustment().

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: A #GtkTreeView

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkAdjustment to set.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_expander_column
function.description: Sets the column to draw the expander arrow at. It must be in the TreeView. See also reset_expander_column().

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: A #GtkTreeView

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: The column to draw the expander arrow at.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_cursor
function.description: Sets the current keyboard focus to be at @path, and selects it. This is useful when you want to focus the user's attention on a particular row. Focus is given to the column specified. Additionally, if @start_editing is %TRUE, then editing should be started in the specified cell. This function is often followed by Gtk::Widget::grab_focus(@tree_view) in order to give keyboard focus to the widget. Please note that editing can only happen when the widget is realized.

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: A #GtkTreeView

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: A #GtkTreePath

parameter.name: focus_column
parameter.parameter_description: A #GtkTreeViewColumn.

parameter.name: start_editing
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the specified cell should start being edited.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_model
function.description: Sets the model for a #GtkTreeView. If the @tree_view already has a model set, it will remove it before setting the new model. Use unset_model() to unset the old model.

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_add_ui
function.description:
Adds a UI element to the current contents of @self.
If @type is %GTK_UI_MANAGER_AUTO, GTK+ inserts a menuitem, toolitem or separator if such an element can be inserted at the place determined by @path. Otherwise @type must indicate an element that can be inserted at the place determined by @path.
@see add_ui_separator().
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkUIManager

parameter.name: merge_id
parameter.parameter_description: the merge id for the merged UI, see gtk_ui_manager_new_merge_id()

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a path

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name for the added UI element

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the action to be proxied, if this is not a separator.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: the type of UI element to add.

parameter.name: top
parameter.parameter_description: if %TRUE, the UI element is added before its siblings, otherwise it is added after its siblings.

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkWindow

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the default width.

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the default height.

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkWindow

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: return location for width.

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: return location for height.

function.name: gtk_icon_info_get_filename
function.return: the filename for the icon, or %NULL if gtk_icon_info_get_builtin_pixbuf() should be used instead.

function.name: gtk_icon_info_get_builtin_pixbuf

parameter.name: icon_info
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkIconInfo structure

function.return: the built-in image pixbuf, or %NULL. The returned image must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_filename
function.return: the filename to preview, or an empty string if no file is selected, or if the selected file cannot be represented as a local filename.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_uri
function.return: the URI for the file to preview, or an empty string if no file is selected.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_current_folder_uri
function.return: the URI for the current folder.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_uri
function.return: The currently selected URI, or an empty string if no file is selected.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_filename
function.return: The currently selected filename, or an empty string if no file is selected, or the selected file can't be represented with a local filename.

parameter.name: cell
parameter.parameter_description: A #GtkCellRenderer

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: location to fill in with the fixed width of the widget.

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: location to fill in with the fixed height of the widget.

function.name: gtk_cell_view_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model for @cell_view. If @cell_view already has a model set, it will remove it before setting the new model. Use unset_model() to unset the old model.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_text_iter_forward_search
function.description:
Searches forward for @str. Any match is returned by setting @match_start to the first character of the match and @match_end to the first character after the match. The search will not continue past @limit. Note that a search is a linear or O(n) operation, so you may wish to use @limit to avoid locking up your UI on large buffers.
If the #GTK_TEXT_SEARCH_VISIBLE_ONLY flag is present, the match may have invisible text interspersed in @str. i.e. @str will be a possibly-noncontiguous subsequence of the matched range. similarly, if you specify #GTK_TEXT_SEARCH_TEXT_ONLY, the match may have pixbufs or child widgets mixed inside the matched range. If these flags are not given, the match must be exact; the special 0xFFFC character in @str will match embedded pixbufs or child widgets.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: start of search

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: a search string

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags affecting how the search is done

parameter.name: match_start
parameter.parameter_description: return location for start of match

parameter.name: match_end
parameter.parameter_description: return location for end of match

parameter.name: limit
parameter.parameter_description: bound for the search

function.name: gtk_text_iter_backward_search
function.description: Same as gtk_text_iter_forward_search(), but moves backward.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTextIter where the search begins

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: search string

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: bitmask of flags affecting the search

parameter.name: match_start
parameter.parameter_description: return location for start of match

parameter.name: match_end
parameter.parameter_description: return location for end of match

parameter.name: limit
parameter.parameter_description: location of last possible @match_start

function.name: gtk_button_get_image
function.description:
Gets the widget that is currenty set as the image of @button. This may have been explicitly set by set_image() or specified as a stock item to the constructor.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_image_set_from_stock
function.description: See the Image::Image(const Gtk::StockID& stock_id, IconSize size) constructor for details.

function.name: gtk_image_set_from_pixbuf
function.description: See the Image::Image(const Glib::RefPtr<Gdk::Pixbuf>& pixbuf) constructor for details.

parameter.name: image
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkImage

parameter.name: pixbuf
parameter.parameter_description: a #Gdk::Pixbuf

function.name: gtk_image_set_from_file
function.description: See the Image::Image(const std::string& file) constructor for details.

parameter.name: image
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkImage

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: a filename.

function.name: gtk_image_set_from_icon_name
function.description:
Causes the Image to display an icon from the current icon theme. If the icon name isn't known, a "broken image" icon will be displayed instead. If the current icon theme is changed, the icon will be updated appropriately.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_icon_factory_add_default
function.description: Adds an icon factory to the list of icon factories searched by gtk_style_lookup_icon_set(). This means that, for example, the Image::Image(const Gtk::StockID& stock_id, IconSize size) constructor will be able to find icons in @factory. There will normally be an icon factory added for each library or application that comes with icons. The default icon factories can be overridden by themes.

function.name: gtk_tool_button_set_stock_id
function.description:
Sets the name of the stock item. See the ToolButton::ToolButton(const Gtk::StockID& stock_id, IconSize size) constructor. The stock_id property only has an effect if not overridden by "label" and "icon_widget" properties.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_image_get_icon_name
function.description:
Gets the icon name and size being displayed by the #GtkImage. The storage type of the image must be %GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or %GTK_IMAGE_ICON_NAME (see gtk_image_get_storage_type()).
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: image
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkImage

parameter.name: icon_name
parameter.parameter_description: place to store an icon name

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: place to store an icon size

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_get_text
function.description: Retrieves the text displayed superimposed on the progress bar, if any.
function.return: text.

function.name: gtk_color_button_get_title
function.return: The title

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_current_folder
function.description:
Gets the current folder of @chooser as a local filename. See gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder().
Since: 2.4
function.return: the full path of the current folder, possibly empty if the current path cannot be represented as a local filename. This function may also return and empty string if the file chooser was unable to load the last folder that was requested from it; for example, as would be for calling gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder() on a nonexistent folder.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_list_shortcut_folders
function.return: A list of folder filenames, if there are any shortcut folders.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_list_shortcut_folder_uris
function.return: A list of folder URIs

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_list_filters
function.return: a list containing the current set of user selectable filters.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_uris
function.return: a list containing the URIs of all selected files and subfolders in the current folder.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_filenames
function.return: a list containing the filenames of all selected files and subfolders in the current folder.

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_list_icons
function.description:
Lists a subset of icons in the current icon theme, by providing a context string. The set of values for the context string is system dependent, but will typically include such values as 'Applications' and 'MimeTypes'.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: icon_theme
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkIconTheme

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: a string identifying a particular type of icon.

function.return: The names of all the icons in the theme.

function.name: gtk_widget_add_mnemonic_label
function.description:
Adds a widget to the list of mnemonic labels for this widget. (See gtk_widget_list_mnemonic_labels()). Note the list of mnemonic labels for the widget is cleared when the widget is destroyed, so the caller must make sure to update its internal state at this point as well.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_container_remove
function.description: Removes @widget from @container. @widget must be inside @container. If @widget is managed with Gtk::manage(), and you don't want to use @widget again then you should delete @widget, because there will no longer be any parent container to delete it automatically.

parameter.name: setup
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkPageSetup

parameter.name: key_file
parameter.parameter_description: the Glib::KeyFile to save the page setup to

parameter.name: group_name
parameter.parameter_description: the group to add the settings to in @key_file.

parameter.name: settings
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkPrintSettings

parameter.name: key_file
parameter.parameter_description: the Glib::KeyFile to save the print settings to

parameter.name: group_name
parameter.parameter_description: the group to add the settings to in @key_file.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_program_name
function.return: The program name.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_website_label
function.return: The label used for the website link.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_completion_prefix
function.description:
Get the original text entered by the user that triggered the completion or an empty string if there's no completion ongoing.
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model for a #GtkEntryCompletion. If @completion already has a model set, it will remove it before setting the new model. Use unset_model() to unset the old model.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_choose_icon
function.description:
Looks up a named icon and returns a structure containing information such as the filename of the icon. The icon can then be rendered into a pixbuf using gtk_icon_info_load_icon(). (gtk_icon_theme_load_icon() combines these two steps if all you need is the pixbuf.)
If @icon_names contains more than one name, this function tries them all in the given order before falling back to inherited icon themes.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: icon_theme
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkIconTheme

parameter.name: icon_names
parameter.parameter_description: array of icon names to lookup

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: desired icon size

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags modifying the behavior of the icon lookup

function.return: a #GtkIconInfo structure containing information about the icon. IconInfo::operator bool() will be false if the icon wasn't found - for instance, if (icon_info) { ... }.

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_list_contexts
function.description:
Gets the list of contexts available within the current hierarchy of icon themes.
Since: 2.12
function.return: a list holding the names of all the contexts in the theme.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model for a #GtkIconView. If the @icon_view already has a model set, it will remove it before setting the new model. Use unset_model() to unset the old model.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_tooltip_cell
function.description:
Sets the tip area of @tooltip to the area which @cell occupies in the item pointed to by @path. See also Tooltip::set_tip_area().
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: icon_view
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkIconView

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTooltip

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath

parameter.name: cell
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkCellRenderer.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_tooltip_item
function.description:
Sets the tip area of @tooltip to be the area covered by the item at @path. See also Tooltip::set_tip_area().
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model used by @combo_box to be @model. Will unset a previously set model (if applicable). Use unset_model() to unset the old model.
Note that this function does not clear the cell renderers, you have to call gtk_cell_layout_clear() yourself if you need to set up different cell renderers for the new model.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_page_setup_to_file
gtk_print_settings_to_file
gtk_printer_request_details
function.description:
Requests the printer details. When the details are available, the details_acquired signal will be emitted.
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_get_cells
function.description:
Return value: a list of cell renderers.
Since: 2.12
function.return: a list of cell renderers.

function.name: gtk_widget_error_bell
function.description:
Notifies the user about an input-related error on this widget. If the Gtk::Settings gtk-error-bell property is true, it calls Gdk::Window::beep(), otherwise it does nothing.
Note that the effect of Gdk::Window::beep() can be configured in many ways, depending on the windowing backend and the desktop environment or window manager that is used.
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_widget_get_tooltip_markup
function.return: the tooltip text.

function.name: gtk_widget_get_tooltip_text
function.return: the tooltip text.

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_lookup_icon
function.description:
Looks up a named icon and returns a structure containing information such as the filename of the icon. The icon can then be rendered into a pixbuf using gtk_icon_info_load_icon(). (gtk_icon_theme_load_icon() combines these two steps if all you need is the pixbuf.)
Since: 2.4
function.return: an IconInfo structure containing information about the icon. IconInfo::operator bool() will return false if the icon wasn't found. For instance, if (icon_info) { ... }.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_text
function.description: Retrieves the contents of the entry widget. See also gtk_editable_get_chars().
function.return: The contents of the entry widget.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_get_uris
function.description:
Gets the contents of the selection data as a container of URIs.
Since: 2.6
function.return: If the selection data contains a list of URIs, a container containing the URIs, otherwise an empty container.

function.name: gtk_builder_get_objects
function.description:
Gets all objects that have been constructed by the Gtk::Builder.
Since: 3.8
function.return: a vector containing all the objects constructed by the Gtk::Builder instance.
